title: getLogs timeouts since block 9160000 on Goerli

body: Hey thanks for the report and charts. We have some aggregate bloom filters for ranges of blocks that should prevent looking into too many blocks for an event that doesn't exist wastelessly. My guess is those are overflown. But interesting you say this slowdown is not seen on mainnet. We should reproduce this as a first step.

About `Goerli` vs `Mainnet`, I notice the volume of logs has some huge spikes for a month on goerli. So indeed might have some optimisations to do when that happens. 

```sql
SELECT
date_trunc('day', block_time) AS day,
COUNT(*) AS vol
FROM goerli.logs
WHERE block_time > date '2023-03-01'
GROUP BY date_trunc('day', block_time)
```    

![CleanShot 2023-07-10 at 17 40 22](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/assets/334996/a41d4c37-a673-4eb3-969a-eb1054f1ee7c)

```sql
SELECT
date_trunc('day', block_time) AS day,
COUNT(*) AS vol
FROM ethereum.logs
WHERE block_time > date '2023-03-01'
GROUP BY date_trunc('day', block_time)
```

![CleanShot 2023-07-10 at 17 40 57](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/assets/334996/2965ea94-8fd9-446c-a70a-e0ed3c7a774c)

Seems Geth's bloom filter did have some performance bottlenecks, it's fp is high(~30%), metriced by https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/4345e9e9b918c1a25516a496932396694c742023 and the request script looks like below:

```python
from time import time
import requests

endpoint = "http://127.0.0.1:8545"
topic = "0x1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678900000"
# topic = "0x74bbc026808dcba59692d6a8bb20596849ca718e10e2432c6cdf48af865bc5d9"
# topic = "0xddf252ad1be2c89b69c2b068fc378daa952ba7f163c4a11628f55a4df523b3ef"
start = 9160000

for step in (10, 50, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 10000, 20000, 30000, 50000, 60000, 70000, 80000, 90000, 100000, 200000, 500000, 900000, 1000000):
    req = dict(
        jsonrpc="2.0",
        method="eth_getLogs",
        id=step,
        params=[
            {
                "fromBlock": hex(start),
                "toBlock": hex(start + step),
                "topics": [topic],
            }
        ],
    )

    st0 = time()
    r = requests.post(endpoint, json=req)
    st1 = time()

    print(
        "step: %06d[{%d, %d}], time: %fs logs: %d"
        % (step, start, start + step, st1 - st0, r.json()["result"].__len__())
    )

    if st1 - st0 > 30:
        break
```

Run Geth in Goerila:

```bash
./geth --goerli --nodiscover --maxpeers 0 --http --http.addr=0.0.0.0
```

After execute with the above python script, the logs in Geth looks like below:
